message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a unique opportunity to own something truly special. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $15000 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $10000. Can you meet me in the middle?

I understand your concerns, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $10000. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer you the product for $13000. This is a great compromise, considering the value of the product. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $13000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to go up to $11500. Can you meet me at this price?

I understand that $11500 is a good offer, but I'm still not willing to sell the product at that price. I'm willing to meet you at $12800, which is a slight increase from my previous offer. This is a fair price considering the value of the product. What do you think?
I appreciate your persistence, but $12800 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $12000. Can you meet me at this price?

I'm getting close to accepting your offer, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product at $12000. I'm willing to meet you at $12500, which is a slight increase from your offer. This is a fair price considering the value of the product. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $12500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $12200. Can you meet me at this price?

I'm starting to get close to accepting your offer, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product at $12200. I'm willing to meet you at $12400, which is a slight increase from your offer. This is a fair price considering the value of the product. What do you think?
I'm willing to make one last offer. I'm willing to pay $12000 for the product. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any higher. Please let me know if you're willing to accept it.
